question.title: Swagger for a spring boot application shows placeholder instead of Project name, version etc
question.body:
Swagger for my spring boot application shows placeholders instead of actual values like

@project.name@ , @project.version@

@project.description@

@{operation.tag} POST / ${operation.desc}

File: application.properties

info.app.artifact=@project.artifactId@
info.app.name=@project.name@
info.app.description=@project.description@
info.app.version=@project.version@

File: api-documentation.properties

operation.tag=Operation_Name
operation.desc=This operation is to retrieve records from database.

File: pom.xml contains:

...............
...............
<artifactId>my-project</artifactId>
<version>${major.number}.${minor.number}.${build.number}-${tag}</version>
<name>my-project</name>
...............
...............

I have tried the following 3 things:

1.Ensure that filtering is enabled for the application.properties file in the pom.xml:

............
<build>
    <resources>
        <resource>
            <directory>src/main/resources</directory>
            <filtering>true</filtering>
        </resource>
    </resources>
</build>
............

2.Define Placeholders in pom.xml: Verify that the placeholders are defined in the section of the pom.xml:

<properties>
        <project.name>My Project Name</project.name>
        <project.description>Spring boot based project to test swagger</project.description>
        <project.version>1.0.0-SNAPSHOT</project.version> 
    </properties>

3.Configure Maven Resources Plugin: Ensure the maven-resources-plugin is configured to use @ as the delimiter for placeholders:

<build>
    <plugins>
        <plugin>
            <artifactId>maven-resources-plugin</artifactId>
            <version>3.2.0</version>
            <configuration>
                <delimiters>
                    <delimiter>@</delimiter>
                </delimiters>
                <useDefaultDelimiters>false</useDefaultDelimiters>
            </configuration>
        </plugin>
    </plugins> 
</build>

but nothing worked. Any suggestions please?
